intro: Rudgea gomeziana, commonly known as the Gomeziana rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
